messages: 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:56): whatwg.org slow?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:58): More like not working at all (the spec specifically).
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:58): Chrome automatically suggests the equivalent section of the W3C spec.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:58): Sneaky Google.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:59): It got the WD, though, not the ED.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:05): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Everything 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e related is dead I think
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:06): SSH works.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:06): all seems to work for me...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:06): just a bit slow
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:06): someone at opera is hammering the server
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:06): something to do with the selectors test suite
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:09): blames a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:10): (no evidence it is him)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:10): (apart from a general theory about what is going on)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:11): Well, even then it's not my problem‚Ä¶
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:11): But all the people whose problem it would ordinarily be have gone home
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:11): sighs
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:13): (Provided the theory is right)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:14): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: You should put everything on your server into a convenient bundle so we can download it once :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:16): I'd appreciate outside perspectives on my argument with Justin Lebar on the whatwg list.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:18): Which thread is that, Aryeh?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:19): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, the one on resource packages.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:19): Ah, kk.  I agree with you completely.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:19): Well, then say so on the list.  :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:20): feels like the whole resource packages thing could just lead to a world of pain
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:20): Yeah, it does seem complicated and error-prone.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:21): But it's about as simple as you can get without requiring server changes . . .
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:21): and adding complexity like letting the browser choose what to do depending on the cache state or whatever would make it much much worse
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:21): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: More or less pain than a world without resource packages?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:21): But there are plausible cases where not letting the browser mix cached copies of things would make resource packages a huge performance *loss*.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:21): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Like a more painful world in which some things are slightly faster
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:21): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: doesn't matter who agrees with whom on the whatwg list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:22): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: i only consider the arguments
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:22): e-mails like "i agree" don't even make it to my pile
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:22): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, we're talking about a spec edited by Justin Lebar, not you.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:22): ah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:22): then what's it doing on the whatwg list? there aren't any other editors there at the moment :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:22): (only kidding)

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (20:25): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: If the cases where it can be slower can be predicted by the author in advance it doesn't seem so bad. If the cases don't happen so often it doesn't seem so bad. If the cases are frequent and serious we should probably throw out the whole idea rather than try to add more3 complexity

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:26): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, you'll already see inconsistency if the packaged copy doesn't match the real one, so I don't think it's much more complexity to say the caches can be shared.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:26): I'd imagine it's less implementation complexity to share the caches.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:35): someone e-mailed me asking about the whatwg status annotation password thing (the one that gets sent to you when you log in in the spec)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:35): i didn't understand the question they were asking so i asked them to clarify
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:36): what they're askingme is why the firefox beta is not rendering any pages
9caa09963ca5c8a06e980a6e724d98f8 (20:37): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: point them at http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Ask+a+question
9caa09963ca5c8a06e980a6e724d98f8 (20:37): if you have the time
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:38): the hybi list went from not wanting a variable-width length to wanting a variable-width length on the basis that saving 7 bytes is critical
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:38): 9caa09963ca5c8a06e980a6e724d98f8: too late, but thanks
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:49): There are a heck of a lot of obsolete elements and attributes.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:54): and that list doesn't include obsolete values :-)
